title: 14 Day Suspension
body:
**EDIT:** 
Thanks for the feedback. Everyone can feel free to continue commenting, but I likely won't read the rest. I now understand two things that I did not before:

1. I repeated "zero-tolerance words," and, regardless of context, I was rightfully subjected to penalty.
2. Multiple reports, and single reports, are treated identically and so there is no reason to try to implore others to report.

Thanks again for all clarifications everyone, hopefully my situation could serve as a lesson to others. Mute, report, and move on (I might put that on a t-shirt).

----------------------------------------------------------

**Background:** 
I have been playing since before Season 1, and never had any action taken against my account (chat ban, suspension, etc.). Today I received a 14 day suspension. In the in-client explanation, it gave one chat log as reason for the suspension...I'm trying to figure out how this got me suspended having never had a chat ban or anything else before. I was certainly argumentative, but the punishment does not seem to fit the crime to me; particularly, for a first-time offender.

**Personal assessment**: 
My only thought is that it was for the line: 
> RageExtreme: "retard, f--g, f--gg--t" that feels like the vocab i would expect from you,

where I was quoting the other player, expressing that their game play and verbiage were equally toxic. Given that I was quoting him, and expressing that I don't agree with that language -- rather than expressing it towards anyone -- I'm not sure though. 

**Questions:** 
Does the suspension seem fair, as a first-time punishment, given the chat log (given me being argumentative/toxic during the game)? Do you guys think it was in error, believing I was using those nasty slurs towards somebody?

replies.body:
Yes, it's fair, and no, it's not in error.

There is never any reason to repeat what someone else says. By repeating their hate speech you became their mouthpiece. Others who likely muted them had to be subjected to the toxicity because you chose to repeat it.

Take it as a lesson to not try and take justice into your own hands if you are not qualified to do so.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=L8kNaeJx,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-03T23:45:40.917+0000)

> Take it as a lesson to not try and take justice into your own hands if you are not qualified to do so.

He put the choice in the hands of everyone else, he explained what happened and asked for reports.

Other players do not need to report, for one. Other players also cannot "enact justice" on the offender. Riot is the party with the sole authority to enact justice in League, and one report brings it to Riot's attention. More reports after 1 just get thrown out.

Tldr 14 days is too much for quoting someone the rest of that would not of even gotten a punishment.

Thanks for the input. I was much more aggro than I normally am in chat (admittedly, I had a bad day and was probably projecting that) and so I didn't know if what I said (other than the quote) would normally warrant a suspension. Lesson learned, I'll just mute everyone and avoid chat from now on. Having played the game for almost a decade now it feels very upsetting to be punished so harshly -- but not much to be done now I suppose. I'll just completely stay out of chat.

It should be mentioned that not talking in chat will make the punishments decrease in severity at a much slower rate than if you were using it to talk in a non toxic manner. By not talking in chat you're proving that you can't communicate, not that you are reforming.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=L8kNaeJx,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-03T23:45:40.917+0000)

I did end up putting a ticket into player support asking about the suspension. They were merciful to my plight, and deemed that the suspension was issued in error then suggested that I not quote others' comments to avoid similar issues in the future. I'm grateful for the helpful advice and opinions in this thread, regardless of outcome I certainly will wholesale avoid repeating toxic speech for the numerous reasons you and others mentioned; that said, I thought it might be useful for you to know the outcome of my situation. Cheers.

Interesting, it was a threes game in which we were all talking to one another, so I'm certain there was nobody muting each other -- as a general principle though, I never thought of that. I certainly wasn't looking to take justice into my hands, though I was intending to make sure the third saw his words so that he could report them (since as someone with an ASD I am particularly sensitive to people calling others "retards"). Thanks for your take -- I'll be sure to keep that in mind in the future.

Even if they *didn't* mute, repeating toxicity is not acceptable, and makes you just as bad as the perpetrator. People tend to think of League as real life - it's not. Each player can say their own chat - and no player is forced to say something. It is presumed that you are considering every word you type before you type it, and it shouldn't need a warning that hate speech is not acceptable in game at all.

If hate speech is not acceptable in the game at all then why is the chat filter toggle-able....if hate speech isn't allowed then why is it possible....it would have been impossible for him to repeat what they said if he had no idea what they said...

The chat filter does not just toggle hate speech, but all chat that is banned (including curse words, etc). Further, hate speech is not against the rules in a game where it is a full premade and all of them are okay with some inside use of it.

Yes, I believe that part of the problem is that it actually used to work that way. During the tribunal days, and even pre-tribunal days, it seems that multiple reports were more impactful than individual reports. Riot seems to have done very little in terms of informing the player bases of the way the new system works, and so it is very common to read something to the affect of "PLAYERX was a troll, 9x him" in all chat -- often as a legitimate plea. I understand that it is a **fair** system to say that my repetition of the slurs warrants equal punishment, but I have a hard time believing it is a **just** system. That said, you were correct in an earlier comment that I could have done more research, but as a player that has never (in approx 10 years of playing), and would never utter a slur towards another player, a chat ban would have been more than sufficient to "inform," and subsequently "reform," me. I appreciate your comments thought, particularly the one letting me know that not chatting will make the punishment severity decrease at a slower rate -- that was something I was unaware of.

Thank you. 

As they say, "fools find no pleasure in understanding but delight in airing their own opinions." Being genuinely confused, I certainly intended to gain understanding (and thanks to helpful comments, this was something I was able to do) and had minimal interest in airing a grievance or broadcasting an opinion. While my opinion remains that the punishment was more harsh than necessary for me to be more careful in the future with my words, I can understand and appreciate that general rules and systems (at the scale used in League of Legends) will not be fine tuned for each individual that they are applied to -- large-scale systems can only be so nuanced. So, live and learn. I love this game, and the community in general, and certainly will try to do better in the future.
